methods.text: Returns true if these permissions describe a readonly (unwritable) file.

methods.code: pub fn set_readonly(&mut self, readonly: bool)
methods.text: Modifies the readonly flag for this set of permissions. If the readonly argument is true, using the resulting Permission will update file permissions to forbid writing. Conversely, if itâ€™s false, using the resulting Permission will update file permissions to allow writing.
Returns a copy of the value.
Formats the value using the given formatter.
This method tests for self and other values to be equal, and is used by ==.
Returns the underlying raw st_mode bits that contain the standard Unix permissions for this file.
Sets the underlying raw bits for this set of permissions.
Creates a new instance of Permissions from the given set of Unix permission bits.
